articles.title: NHL notebook: Sabres trade Scandella, add Frolik on busy day
articles.description: The Montreal Canadiens acquired Marco Scandella from the Buffalo Sabres on Thursday and sent fellow defenseman Mike Reilly to the Ottawa Senators in another trade.
articles.content:
The Montreal Canadiens acquired Marco Scandella from the Buffalo Sabres on Thursday and sent fellow defenseman Mike Reilly to the Ottawa Senators in another trade.

articles.author: Seng Li Peng
articles.title: Oil prices jump $1 after U.S air strike kills Iran, Iraq military personnel
articles.description: Oil prices jumped more than $1 on Friday after a U.S. air strike killed key Iranian and Iraqi military personnel, raising concerns that escalating Middle East tensions may disrupt oil supplies.
articles.content:
SINGAPORE (Reuters) - Oil prices jumped more than $1 on Friday after a U.S. air strike killed key Iranian and Iraqi military personnel, raising concerns that escalating Middle East tensions may disrupt oil supplies. 
Brent crude futures LCOc1 were at $67.48 … [+667 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Gold edges up on weaker dollar, set for fourth weekly gain
articles.description: Gold prices inched up on Friday, on track to record a fourth consecutive weekly gain, as the dollar eased, while investors awaited the release of minutes from the U.S. Federal Reserve's December meeting.
articles.content:
(Reuters) - Gold prices inched up on Friday, on track to record a fourth consecutive weekly gain, as the dollar eased, while investors awaited the release of minutes from the U.S. Federal Reserve’s December meeting.

articles.title: China's RRR still relatively high by global standards, can be adjusted further - PBOC official
articles.description: The proportion of money that Chinese banks must set aside as reserves is still relatively high by global standards, and can be adjusted in future to help provide long-term, stable liquidity to the economy, a senior central banker said.

articles.author: Wayne Cole
articles.title: Dollar gets reprieve ahead of key U.S. factory survey
articles.description: The dollar shook off recent weakness on Friday as dismal economic news from Europe and the UK weighed on major rivals, while figures due later in the session are expected to point to some improvement in U.S. manufacturing.
articles.content:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - The dollar shook off recent weakness on Friday as dismal economic news from Europe and the UK weighed on major rivals, while figures due later in the session are expected to point to some improvement in U.S. manufacturing.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Strikes against two targets linked to Iran: U.S. officials
articles.description: Strikes have been carried out against two targets linked to Iran in Baghdad on Thursday, U.S. officials told Reuters.
articles.content:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Strikes have been carried out against two targets linked to Iran in Baghdad on Thursday, U.S. officials told Reuters. 
The officials, speaking on the condition of anonymity, declined to give any further details.

articles.title: Iran's Soleimani and Iraq's Muhandis killed in air strike: militia spokesman
articles.description: Iranian Major-General Qassem Soleimani, head of the elite Quds Force, and Iraqi militia commander Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis were killed late on Thursday in an air strike on their convoy in Baghdad airport, an Iraqi militia spokesman told Reuters.
articles.content: BAGHDAD (Reuters) - Iranian Major-General Qassem Soleimani, head of the elite Quds Force, and Iraqi militia commander Abu Mahdi al-Muhandis were killed late on Thursday in an air strike on their convoy in Baghdad airport, an Iraqi militia spokesman told Reute… [+324 chars]

articles.author: Nick Mulvenney
articles.title: Australian tennis tournament relocated due to bushfire threat
articles.description: A professional tennis tournament scheduled to take place in Canberra next week has been moved to the city of Bendigo because of the likelihood of disruption caused by smoke from the bushfires raging around southeast Australia.
articles.content:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - A professional tennis tournament scheduled to take place in Canberra next week has been moved to the city of Bendigo because of the likelihood of disruption caused by smoke from the bushfires raging around southeast Australia.

articles.title: Australian Prime Minister jeered by angry bushfire victims
articles.description: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison faced enraged hecklers and an angry firefighter in a town ravaged by bushfires, piling pressure on the leader amid an unprecedented crisis that has killed at least 18 people.
